orbit.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to travel in a curved path around a much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc
orbit.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The satellite orbits the Earth every 48 hours.
orbit.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: the curved path travelled by an object which is moving around another much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc
orbit.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: the Moonâ€™s orbit around the Earth
The space shuttle is now in orbit.
The telecommunications satellite went into orbit at the end of last year.
orbit.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: the area of power and influence of a person, an organization etc
orbit.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: countries within the orbit of the British Commonwealth
